boardgame.name: Caylus Magna Carta
케일러스 마그나 카르타
boardgame.description: The general theme and mechanics of Caylus Magna Carta are similar to the Caylus board game. However, there is no board or score track and the tactical nuts and bolts of the game are somewhat different. In terms of components, the game consists of cards, money, worker pawns, resource markers, the provost, and castle building stones. Each player has a set of identical cards, which are shuffled and used as a face-down draw deck. Players start with an opening random draw of cards, and on his turn a player can either:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; extend the road by building a new building _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; pay 1 to draw a new building card _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; pay 1 to discard his hand and draw a fresh hand (with the discard deck being shuffled for a new draw deck once the draw deck is exhausted) _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; pay 1 to place a worker on one of the existing building cards _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; build one of the common prestige building cards (some of which are placed at the beginning of the game as part of the setup) or _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; pass_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Once everyone has passed, the cards are resolved up to the provost (which can be moved in passing order by paying money)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Ownership of the non-common buildings is shown by the card color. When a worker is placed on a card, the owner earns either resources or money as a reward instead of victory points. Players may also choose to help build the castle. Starting with the first player to have passed, players can pay resources to obtain castle stones. The stones are worth three different values (2-4 points). Players collect the most valuable ones first. In addition, the player who collects the most building stones each round is rewarded with a gold resource marker._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;From round to round, 1st player privileges rotate to the left, and the provost starts two cards further down the path from the castle._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The winner of the game is the player who has accumulated the most victory points once the game end has been triggered the turn the castle is finished. Victory points are awarded for castle stones, cards built, and resources and money in hand at the end of the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Reserved for jeremylguntner for pickup at Gen Con Please submit payment via PayPal, Google Wallet or Venmo to gramaw@gmail.com. Alternatively, you may pay, via one of these methods or COD, directly at the convention. Since I am selling so many games I plan to meet as many buyers as possible on Saturday morning at 9AM outside of hall A on level 1 of the convention center, near room 128 (this was the former location of multiple Gen Con Math trade meetups, in case you are familiar.) You can find a link to a map of the denoted area here: https://boardgamegeek.com/image/4236187/gramaw If at all possible please meet me at this time and location. If this will not be possible, please Geekmail me so we can make an alternative arrangement. Lastly, my phone number is 847.454.6369 if you need to reach me at the convention.

I sell the German edition of Caylus Magna Carta including: * Base game * The library mini expansion * The Favors expansion I sell all items in one package not separately. NOTES: - The components are in very good condition (one green wooden disc has a little crack). - 4 wooden discs are missing for the orange player which are necessary if you want to play with 5 players and the expansion. The discs can be replaced at any board game store. - The rules for the Library expansion is self-printed, it is not the original one. It includes both: German and English language. The rules for the base game are in German (original rules book).
